item.title: nest cog with discord.py
item.description: # Premise discord.py python3.6 The code in this article is a simplified code for explanation purposes only, so only nonsense code will appear. Please note. #cog is getting complicated The command extension of discord.py (https://discordpy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ext/commands/index.html) has a function called “cog” that groups together several commands and events. in this way from discord.ext import commands as c class CogHogeFuga(c.Cog): def __init__(self, bot, hoge): self._bot = bot self._hoge = hoge @c.
